v8:item.v8:content:
<b>Order state</> is a set of parameters that define an order status, for example, whether the order is complete or only awaiting appointment. It is determined by its state.
The status which was established for the order defines the behavior of the document.
<b>The following </><b>states are defined:</>
• <b>In progress</> - order data will be reflected in the account. • <b>Completed</> -set by a user on order fulfillment. • <b>Canceled</> - the order is not reflected in the account.
Quick filter and color assignment for document view by status are available for orders list.
Color purpose for order status to a vendor is determined by the section <link SettingsAccountingProduction>Settings - Accounting settings -Produc</><link SettingsAccountingProduction>tion</>.

<b>Order state</> is a set of parameters that define an order status, for example, whether the order is complete or only awaiting appointment. It is determined by its state. User can create any convenient conditions for statuses value work.
<b>Each state is </><b>assigned with the status:</>
• <b>Opened </>– order will play the role of the advance application. • <b>In progress</> - order data will be reflected in the account. • <b>Completed</> -set by a user on order fulfillment. To close the order which has a Completed status you should select the <b>Closed</> check box.
To cancel an order with states "Opened" or "In progress", select the <b>Closed</> check box.
Quick filter and color assignment for document view by status are available for orders list. Content of the statuses list is determined by the contents of Orders to production status reference. Catalog is available on the eponymous hyperlink in section <link SettingsAcountingPoduction>Settings - Accounting settings - Production</>.
Status by default for a new order for production is determined in the user settings.
Fill in by the sales order
Fill in by the sales order
Fill in reserve according to the available remaining goods in warehouse
